BigInteger is in rt.jar and can therefore not be moved. Do you have your own 
BigInteger implementation ?

What I meant is that I have a member field (public static final) of type
BigInteger. Moving the field triggered the exception.

Genady

Genady,

the problem is that I can't properly resolve the destination type. Instead of 
throughing an exception I now present a status to the user. However I would 
like to understand why this happened. Did the destination type have "serious" 
compiler errors like missing brackets or unresolved super types ?

verified in I-I20040528-200405280010 in code that classcast exception is not 
possible anymore

I don't remember what exactly I did, and I cannot reproduce it anymore.

It is quite possible there were compilation errors in the destination type, 
but most likely they were unimplemented methods.
